meanings.definition: The floor of a fireplace, usually of stone, brick, etc., often extending a short distance into a room.
meanings.sent1: The hearths in old houses were made of sturdy stone.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered around the hearths to stay warm on cold nights.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided the hearths were the perfect spot for a nap.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the hearths of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent5: The crackling fire in the hearths filled the room with a cozy glow.

meanings.definition: A home symbolized as a part of the earth, as in the phrase hearth and home.
meanings.sent1: The hearths of the village were always welcoming to travelers.
meanings.sent2: She believed that hearths were the heart of every home.
meanings.sent3: The hearths of the neighborhood seemed to gossip with each other.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as strong as the hearths of their ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The hearths of the town shone brightly during the festive season.
